intro: Dicalix liukiuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu dicalix, is a rare flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands in Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four to five petals. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
